What is the purpose of the `backupwallet` command in Verus?

The `backupwallet` command is used to safely copy the `wallet.dat` file to a specified destination filename. This command helps to create a backup of your wallet, ensuring that your funds and wallet information are secure.

backupwallet "destination" Safely copies wallet.dat to destination filename Arguments: 1. "destination"  (string, required) The destination filename, saved in the directory set by -exportdir option. Result: "path"       (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus backupwallet "backupdata" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "backupwallet", "params": ["backupdata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/backupwallet
What arguments are required for the `backupwallet` command?
The `backupwallet` command requires one argument: the destination filename, which is a string. This is the file where the `wallet.dat` will be copied.

backupwallet "destination" Safely copies wallet.dat to destination filename Arguments: 1. "destination"  (string, required) The destination filename, saved in the directory set by -exportdir option. Result: "path"       (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus backupwallet "backupdata" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "backupwallet", "params": ["backupdata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/backupwallet
How can I specify the directory where the backup file will be saved?
The directory where the backup file will be saved is set by the `-exportdir` option. You need to specify this option before running the `backupwallet` command.

backupwallet "destination" Safely copies wallet.dat to destination filename Arguments: 1. "destination"  (string, required) The destination filename, saved in the directory set by -exportdir option. Result: "path"       (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus backupwallet "backupdata" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "backupwallet", "params": ["backupdata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/backupwallet
What is the result of running the `backupwallet` command?
The result of running the `backupwallet` command is the full path of the destination file, which is returned as a string.

backupwallet "destination" Safely copies wallet.dat to destination filename Arguments: 1. "destination"  (string, required) The destination filename, saved in the directory set by -exportdir option. Result: "path"       (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus backupwallet "backupdata" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "backupwallet", "params": ["backupdata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/backupwallet
How can I use the `backupwallet` command using the command line?

You can use the `backupwallet` command using the command line by running the following command: `verus backupwallet "destination"`, where "destination" is the filename where you want to save the backup.

backupwallet "destination" Safely copies wallet.dat to destination filename Arguments: 1. "destination"  (string, required) The destination filename, saved in the directory set by -exportdir option. Result: "path"       (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus backupwallet "backupdata" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "backupwallet", "params": ["backupdata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/backupwallet
How can I use the `backupwallet` command using curl?

You can use the `backupwallet` command using curl by running the following command: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "backupwallet", "params": ["backupdata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`, where "myusername" is your username, "backupdata" is the destination filename, and `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` is the RPC endpoint.
